channel.title: Connecting to the internet with dial up on Ubuntu
channel.description:
I just got Ubuntu 5.10 and am currently running it off the disk.
The problem is I don't know how to connect to the internet with it. I'm on dial up which makes things difficult.. :confused:

item.title: Connecting to the internet with dial up on Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @blackhat blackhat
item.description:
@blackhat wrote:

lol n00bs b00bs all noobs..

go to Yast and install a package called Kinternet (if u using kde or knome) it is a dial up utility that will detect ya modem,

there noobs telling u how to use wirless and cable and broadband u wont dial up like your topic states right??

is anyone on this fourm over 21?

Read full topic
item.source: Connecting to the internet with dial up on Ubuntu

item.title: Connecting to the internet with dial up on Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @afi afi
item.description:
@afi wrote:

Go to Properties>enable wireless and LAN> Configure Lan> Click the drop down it should be there.

Read full topic
